alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:12PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Smyth, southwestern Wythe and north central Grayson Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 311 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Hungry Mother State Park, or near Marion, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Rural Retreat... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Sugar Grove... Nebo... Hungry Mother State Park... and Broadford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
